text.section:
The Commissioner may require, by regulation, that an employer keep:
an accurate record of:
each work-related death;
each work-related illness; and
each work-related injury other than a minor injury that requires only first aid treatment and does not involve loss of consciousness, medical treatment, restriction of motion or work, or transfer to another job; and
each other record about an activity of the employer under this title that the Commissioner considers appropriate or necessary to develop information about the causes and prevention of occupational accidents, illnesses, and injuries.
Each employer shall make available to the Commissioner each record that the employer is required to keep under subsection (a)(2) of this section.

section.section:
An employer shall report orally to the Commissioner an employment accident within 8 hours after it occurs if the accident results in:
the death of an employee; or
hospitalization of at least three employees.

Each employer shall send to the Commissioner a copy of each report of an accident or injury that the employer:
is required, under Title 9 of this article, to send to the Workers' Compensation Commission; or
submits to the Injured Workers' Insurance Fund.
